game.zilch

Class Die

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.zilch.Die

  • public class Die
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a comprehensive die rolling object that can go from 1 to the limit of integer's positive range.
    Author:
    Chad J Lucas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Die()
      By default the max value is 6 because most dice made are 6.
      Die(int maxValue)
      This will set the maximum value of the die to the value passed in.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Die

        public Die()
        By default the max value is 6 because most dice made are 6. This is so it can also generate the right values;

      • Die

        public Die(int maxValue)
        This will set the maximum value of the die to the value passed in. If it takes a negative number, it will be set positive because this class really shouldn't be throwing exceptions for something so basic. It's really your fault if you pass in a negative value expecting something as intuitive as a dice roller to do something different.
        Parameters:
        maxValue - Takes the absolute value of this number and sets it as max value

        public int getLastValue()
        This class saves the last value that was rolled for your convenience.
        Returns:

      • getMaxValue

        public int getMaxValue()
        The maximum value a roll will generate.
        Returns:
        The maximum value a roll will generate.

      • setMaxValue

        public void setMaxValue(int maxValue)
        Sets maxValue field to the absolute value of what is passed into this method.
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The magnitude of the maximum possible outcome form this roller.

      • roll

        public int roll()
        Roll will generate a number from 1 to maxValue.
        Returns:
        1 to maxValue.
